snippet: It is a mistake to ignore faster-growing sectors, like technology and industrial companies, despite the economic worries that rattle the markets.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column contends that it is a mistake to ignore faster-growing sectors, like technology and industrial shares, despite the economic worries that rattle the markets; points out that the consensus among Wall Street analysts is that profits for tech companies in the Standard & Poor's 500-stock index will grow 9 percent in 2012, while industrial-sector earnings are forecast to rise 10.6 percent.
lead_paragraph: It is a mistake to ignore faster-growing sectors, like technology and industrial companies, despite the economic worries that rattle the markets.

headline.seo: Fundamentally: Don’t Shy Away From Growth Stocks
headline.main: Don’t Shy Away From Growth Stocks
headline.print_headline: Don’t Shy Away From Growth Stocks
